text:
The earth is soft beneath your boots, ashen and cracked from centuries of smoldering sorrow. You step cautiously through the ruined courtyard of the Ashen Ruins. What was once a bastion of the Flamebearers now lies drowned in silence, choked by creeping vines and ember-choked winds. Statues of forgotten sentinels stare blankly toward the horizon, their swords long dulled by time.

Faint markings on the stone whisper of a forgotten oath, half-buried by soot and moss. The Flame did not die here—it was consumed. And something darker rose in its place. Ahead, two paths reveal themselves: one winding toward a charred boneyard, the other downward into what seems like a broken cathedral swallowed by the land.
lore: The Flamebearers' First Bastion was struck down in the Hour of Betrayal. Some say it was not the enemy that broke their gates, but the betrayal of flame itself—an ember that turned against its master.
